It’s time to take note of how Utah keeps our fiscal house in order by balancing our budget every year. I remain committed to working with our delegation and my colleagues in Congress to reign in out-of-control spending. #utpol

We must take meaningful steps towards reigning in spending and reducing our debt. Every household and small business has to balance their checkbooks and live within their means. Why should Washington be exempt? #utpol
For the first time this unchecked federal spending will lead to a $1 trillion deficit, and nothing will be done to address America’s $20 trillion debt. This is a reckless way to govern #utpol
I was disappointed that many of my colleagues demonstrated their lack of fiscal restraint by voting to kill the balanced budget amendment. #utpol

@HouseSmallBiz @RepChrisStewart It is clear to me that instead of withdrawing from #NAFTA, we need to continue to negotiate the successful modernization of the trade agreement to include things like digital trade, labor, property protections, and anti-corruption. #utpol

As a former businessman and member of @HouseSmallBiz, hearing the perspective of manufacturing industry leaders on the importance of trade to #Utah and the US economy is critical. That's why I organized a #NAFTA Roundtable with @RepChrisStewart. #utpol https://t.co/l0ktiEMyX9

Utah is a hotspot for innovative start-up companies and small businesses, and in fact, nearly half of Utahns work for a small business. Unfortunately, our #smallbusinesses are constantly threatened by cyber-attacks and are severely underequipped to defend themselves.

Tonight I am encouraged that President Trump expressed a desire to come together to solve immigration and rightfully challenged Congress to act. We cannot afford to waste this once-in-a-generation opportunity for real reform. #SOTU

Our nation, and especially Utah, will benefit from the $1 trillion investment in our nation’s infrastructure. In addition to rebuilding and repair our aging roads and bridges, we must also invest in rural broadband infrastructure. #SOTU

The #TaxCutsandJobsAct has proven not to be Armageddon. 3 million Americans are already seeing the return on their paychecks because we delivered a fairer, simpler, pro-family tax code to give more money back to taxpayers and spur economic growth #SOTU
My first few months in Congress have been exciting: I’ve flown on Air Force One, introduced legislation, voted for the historic #TaxCutsandJobsAct, and now I’m witnessing my first #SOTU

I’m prepared to take the tough votes and will work with my colleagues from both sides of aisle to find answers for DACA as soon as the shutdown is over. 4/4 #utpol
I’ll stay in in DC working on solutions with members of both parties to bring the shutdown to a conclusion and find answers. This what the American public expects. 3/4

My DC and Utah offices will stay open and staffed during the shutdown. Thanks to a team of dedicated employees who will work without promise of compensation, we’ll do all we can to offer our full menu of services. 2/4
II’ve sent instructions to the Clerk to withhold my pay. If the military and my staff aren’t getting paid, Congress shouldn’t be getting paid either. 1/4

Most of my colleagues and many Americans have scars from the last shutdown and had hoped to avoid it at all costs. I am optimistic we can avoid a long shutdown. Here’s my statement on what my constituents can expect from me during the shutdown. #utpol https://t.co/Svrin7etsv

The Senate Democrats have done the unimaginable by turning away from funding CHIP for 9M kids and withholding pay for our military and 800,000 others in exchange for a political bet. This is unacceptable. I’m in DC and ready to work on a deal to get the government back open

I am hopeful we can fix this. A shutdown will cost the American taxpayers and the U.S. economy billions of dollars. I am going to do everything I can to ensure that shutdowns do not become a tradition here.  #utpol
I believe including DACA in a package that also includes border security is essential to preserving the program, creating security for their families, and protecting this country. #utpol

Voting on short term spending deals is not a responsible way to govern. The American people reasonably expect that their elected officials find solutions. We should take the next four weeks to debate a thoughtful DACA solution and reasonable immigration reform package #utpol
We have a lot of important work to do that won’t be accomplished by shutting the government down. This is not an easy decision to make and I’d like to offer some more insight. #utpol
Over 311,000 children in Utah, and nearly 9 million children throughout the US, count on #CHIP. We cannot fail them by shutting down the government.
